title: SEC Proposal Seeks Transparency in How Money Managers Wield Vast Voting Power
sub_head: Rule would require more disclosure on how asset managers handle proxy votes, securities lending
body:
The Securities and Exchange Commission proposed a rule that would require money managers to disclose more information on how they use their voting power.
When investors buy a mutual fund and exchange-traded fund from an asset manager, the money manager votes on shareholder proposals on behalf of the investors. Shareholder votes extend to issues from executive compensation to a companyâ€™s efforts to address climate change.
